data.title: Tesla Is 'Crushing The Auto Industry', Munster Says, As Company Posts Q1 Delivery Figures
data.text: Loup Ventures Managing Partner Gene Munster on Thursday said Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) "is crushing the auto industry," generating significantly higher demand than its competitors.

data.title: Tesla overcomes plant shutdowns to build thousands of cars in the first quarter
data.text: Tesla built more than 100,000 vehicles in the first quarter, despite shutdowns at its plants in Shanghai and Fremont, California, due to health concerns associated with the coronavirus.

data.title: Tesla stock is up 11% in after hours session on Q1 delivery numbers
data.text: Yahoo Finance's Myles Udland, Rick Newman, and Andy Serwer break down the newest delivery numbers from Tesla.

data.title: Tesla Electric Car Deliveries Jump From Year Ago But COVID-19 Cools Pace From Record Q4
data.text: First-quarter deliveries and production beat consensus expectations, but Elon Musk’s electric-car company wasn’t spared from the coronavirus downturn

data.title: Tesla's First-Quarter Deliveries Crush Estimates
data.text: Despite coronavirus headwinds, the electric-car maker set a record for first-quarter deliveries.

data.title: Stock Market Wrap-Up: Tesla Delivers the Goods; Oil Giants Jump
data.text: Stocks posted solid gains Thursday.

data.title: Tesla Q1 deliveries beat, 88.4K vs. 79K estimated
data.text: CNBC's Phil LeBeau reports that Tesla's first quarter deliveries beat estimates.

data.title: Tesla delivers 88,400 electric vehicles, beating expectations
data.text: Tesla delivered 88,400 vehicles in the first quarter, beating most analysts expectations despite a 21% decrease from the previous quarter as the COVID-19 pandemic put downward pressure on demand and created logistical challenges. Tesla said Thursday it produced 103,000 electric vehicles in the first quarter, about 2% lower than the previous period.

data.title: Why Tesla Stock Fell Sharply on Thursday
data.text: The automaker's shares were down more than 5%, probably on comments by a noted short-seller.

data.title: The "Ventilators" in Tesla's Big Coronavirus Donation Were Actually BPAP Machines
data.text: The machines shown in a photo appear to be devices for treating sleep apnea.

data.title: Tesla sees strong Model Y production, deliveries; shares rise
data.text: Tesla Inc  said on Thursday Model Y production and deliveries were significantly ahead of schedule, even as its March quarter deliveries fell short of Wall Street estimates by about 5,000 vehicles.

data.title: Tesla Trades Higher After Strong Q1 Delivery Figures
data.text: Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ: TSLA) shares traded higher after the company reported first-quarter delivery and production figures.

data.title: Tesla Sets Record-Breaking First Quarter in Production and Deliveries
data.text: While the economy has fallen into a recession and while the data coming in the days and weeks ahead may be grim, Tesla Inc.

data.title: Telsa soars on delivery numbers -- company delivered 88,400 vehicles in Q1
data.text: Tesla just reported first quarter vehicle delivery and production numbers for 2020.

data.title: Tesla misses estimates for quarterly deliveries
data.text: Tesla Inc  on Thursday fell short of Wall Street estimates for first-quarter vehicle deliveries, due to the production disruptions and shutdowns caused worldwide by the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: Tesla Q1 2020 Vehicle Production & Deliveries
data.text: PALO ALTO, Calif., April  02, 2020  (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- In the first quarter, we produced almost 103,000 vehicles and delivered approximately 88,400 vehicles. This is our best ever first quarter performance.

data.title: Tesla Continues To Be Losing Option According To This Famous Investor
data.text: Over the last month, Tesla has been trampled on, to say the least. The electric car manufacturer’s stock has gone from a peak of over $915 per share in February to under $365 as stocks plummeted in the fastest bear market fall in history.

data.title: Tesla Is Still A 'Maximum Short' For Chanos
data.text: Kynikos Associates founder Jim Chanos has held a short position in Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) for a long time, and he doesn't appear to be changing his mind anytime soon.

data.title: Billionaire investor Jim Chanos: Still 'maximum short' on Tesla even with recent market moves
data.text: Jim Chanos, Kynikos Associates founder, joins "Fast Money Halftime Report" to discuss Tesla and his short position on the stock.

data.title: Chanos says he is still 'maximum short' Tesla even with drop in last month
data.text: Short seller Jim Chanos said Thursday that he is still betting against Tesla, even after the electric automaker’s stock fell dramatically in the past month.

data.title: Have $1000 to invest? These 3 High-Risk, High-Return Stocks are Buys Right Now
data.text: Incredible growth prospects, enough cash to survive the coronavirus pandemic, and getting closer to profitability make these stocks a buy.

data.title: 'Dear Elon': Ukraine takes up Tesla's ventilator offer via Twitter
data.text: Ukraine has taken to Twitter to ask Elon Musk to send it ventilators after the billionaire chief executive of Tesla Inc  offered to ship them across the world during the coronavirus pandemic.
